p: As shown in Figure 3, S. mukorossi seed oil significantly affected nitric oxide (NO) release in the lipopolysaccharide (LPS)-treated cells. The NO release of the samples was normalized by comparing the measured data to the untreated samples. When the cells were treated with N-nitro- l-arginine-methyl ester ( l-NAME), 21% NO release was noted compared to the control. When the cells were pretreated with 25 μg/mL S. mukorossi seed oil, NO release by the lipopolysaccharide (LPS)-treated RAW 264.7 cells was 92%. This value dramatically decreased to 46% when 500 μg/mL oil was used for pretreatment.
